title: (x) Agel packaging square rounded sans - Cholla Unicase {Yves}
content:
Any ideas on this. My first guess was a modified version of [Carbon](http://web.archive.org/web/20061116104006/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/carbon/bold/) from T-26, but the X is straight and the inside of the O is rounded. Any other fonts similar to that?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [minfont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20061116104006/http:/typophile.com/files/minfont.jpg) | 9.08 KB |
| [exofont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20061116104006/http:/typophile.com/files/exofont.jpg) | 8.52 KB |
author: Brian B

comments.content: I was going to say a _very_ interesting take on this style is [Cholla](http://web.archive.org/web/20061116104006/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=E.105685.0.5&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=MiN+EXO&sampleSize=96) by [Sibylle Hagmann](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Sibylle%20Hagmann), but I think it actually might _be_ Cholla. What do you think?

At first I thought it was carbon with a custom X, but now I’m pretty sure it’s Cholla with a custom R.

Thanks

Sorry, the R was on another product package. The O, X, and N seemed to be what set it apart so I only included those 2 packages. Here is a shot with the P and R

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/pro_3688.jpg)
Looks like the R is really easy to customise indeed.
